pull.title: test: passing a negative value to `-peertimeout` should throw an error
pull.body:
This PR adds test coverage for the following init error:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/5bc10b39abbcb77638161902ccd1225139bc7cc0/src/init.cpp#L967-L970

events.message: test: passing a negative value to `-peertimeout` should throw an error

events.body: While looking at this, noticed that it gives the same error message about "cannot be negative" if you try to start with non-integer `-peertimeout`, which seems wrong.

> While looking at this, noticed that it gives the same error message about "cannot be negative" if you try to start with non-integer -peertimeout, which seems wrong.

Yea, just noticed it. Same if you pass `0`

> @1440000bytes maybe this way? I can address this change in this PR if other reviewers agree.

I added another error message in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25506
Probably it's good idea to first decide about merging or not merging #25506 and then possibly add additional test case here.
Why is this closed? @MarcoFalke I intended to rebase it
It was auto-closed by `github-merge.sh` script, because PR description contained "Fixes" with link to this PR, script didn't understand that it was link to a comment.
@kristapsk oh sorry, didn't notice it. Anyway, I opened #25511 in order to this one. thanks!
